Chap. 3 - The Needs of the Huntsville School

-


         (From letter written Nov. 2, 1904.) 

                                               -
 


     Dear Brethren and Sisters: I would call your special attention to the needs of the Huntsville School. This school is on a farm of over three hundred acres, which was purchased by the General Conference, and given to the work for the colored people of the South. This school farm is to be made a representation of what can be done to help the colored people.
